title: Calories in Ground Pork
meta_description: Discover calories in ground pork per 100 g, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown for easy meal planning.
assumptions: Regular ground pork (about 20% fat), cooked (pan-broiled), no added seasonings or oils.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fat content, cooking method, brand, and portion size. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked ground pork provides ~297 kcal and ~28 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp oil during cooking per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g ground pork?
faqs.a: About 297 kcal for cooked regular ground pork.

faqs.q: What's the protein in ground pork?
faqs.a: Approximately 28 g protein per 100 g cooked.
No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain ground pork.

faqs.q: How does fat content affect calories in ground pork?
faqs.a: Higher fat (e.g., 30%) increases calories to ~350 kcal per 100 g; leaner reduces them.

faqs.q: Are these values for raw or cooked ground pork?
faqs.a: Cooked (broiled); raw is lower density but similar per gram after cooking loss.
